issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Titanium SDK & CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the MobileSDK here.

fields.environment:
Mac OS X Version 10.8.4
Titanium Studio, build: 3.1.3.201309132423
Titanium SDK version 3.1.3.GA
Xcode Version 5.0 (5A1413)

comments.body:
#1 did you open xcode, go to downloads, and download the 6.x simulator image for your xcode 5 install?
#2 if you want to build for ios7 instead of ios6 did you go into your studio settings and change the build settings?

Hello Gordon IIIan,

I check your issue. I can’t reproduce this. Please check your project run configurations setting. I hope that will help to you. 

Thanks

Hello,

I tested this issue with the test code below. I can’t reproduce this issue in Ti SDK 3.1.3GA. Please test this issue using the latest release and let us know your feedback.

h5. Testing Environment:
Ti CLI 3.3.0
Titanium SDK: 3.1.3 and later   
Xcode 5.0
iOS -Simulator -iPhone Retina 3.5 inch/iOS SDK 7.0 

h5. Test Case
{code}
var win = Ti.UI.createWindow();
win.open();

{code}
 
h5. Steps to Reproduce:

# Create a simple project.
# Update this code in app.js
# Run this on iOS Simulator 
# App will be run as well 

 
If we don't hear back from you, we will assume the issue is resolved and the ticket can be closed.
Thanks
